title: Scenario: Item added to the cart and item is changed to out_of_stock before order is placed
custom_preconds:
Given the user has a front end application of food ordering on their device
and the user has added an item to their cart
and the user has accessed the portal - Menu Item tab for the stadium
and stand of which the user has accessed on their application
custom_steps:
When the user changes the status of the item added to the cart to out_of_stock 
and the user clicks update in the portal
and the page refreshes in the portal
and the user clicks checkout in the front end applicaiton
custom_expected:
Then The user will get the message

Invalid Menu Items
You had an invalid item in your cart, we've emptied your cart. please try again.

title: Scenario: Item added to the cart and item is changed to admin_deleted before order is placed
custom_preconds:
Given the user has a front end application of food ordering on their device
and the user has added an item to their cart
and the user has accessed the portal - Menu Item tab for the stadium
and stand of which the user has accessed on their application
custom_steps:
When the user changes the status of the item added to the cart to admin_deleted
and the user clicks update in the portal
and the page updates in the portal
and the user clicks checkout in the front end application
custom_expected:
Then The user will get the message

Invalid Menu Items
You had an invalid item in your cart, we've emptied your cart. please try again.

title: Scenario: Item added to the cart and item is changed to deleted before order is placed
custom_preconds:
Given the user has a front end application of food ordering on their device
and the user has added an item to their cart
and the user has accessed the portal - Menu Item tab for the stadium
and stand of which the user has accessed on their application
custom_steps:
When the user clicks on the show deleted menu item check box to set that value to true
and the user changes the status of the item added to the cart to deleted
and the page updates in the portal
and the user clicks checkout in the front end application
custom_expected:
Then The user will get the message

Invalid Menu Items
You had an invalid item in your cart, we've emptied your cart. please try again.

title: Scenario: Please Select a Stadium Dropdown
custom_preconds: Given The user has accessed the portal
custom_steps: When the user selects the Stadium tab
custom_expected: Then The user will see the 'Please Select a Stadium Dropdown'

title: Scenario: Fields
custom_preconds:
Given The user has accessed the portal
and the user has selected the Stadium tab
and the user has selected a stadium from the please select a stadium drop-down
custom_steps: When the information loads
custom_expected:
Then The fields will be Stadium Code 
and Stadium Type
and Latitude
and Longitude
and Enable Food Order
and Allowed order Type
and End Point

title: Scenario: Stands available through Food Ordering
custom_preconds:
Given The user has accessed the portal
and the user has selected the stadium tab
custom_steps:
When The user clicks on the Please Select a stadium drop down 
and reveals the list of stadiums
custom_expected: Then These stadiums should be the ones that are available to have food ordering access via the front end applications.

title: Scenario: Please Select a Stadium Dropdown
custom_preconds: Given The user has accessed the portal
custom_steps: When The user clicks on the Stand Tab
custom_expected: Then the user will see a 'Please Select a Stadium' dropdown

title: Scenario: Please Select a Stand Dropdown
custom_preconds:
Given The user has accessed the portal
and has selected the Stand tab
custom_steps: When the user has selected a stadium from the 'Please select a stadium' drop-down
custom_expected:
Then a 'Please select a stand' drop-down will appear
and the stands that are listed will be ones that have been entered into the database

title: Scenario: Fields
custom_preconds:
Given The user has accessed the portal
and the user has selected the Stand tab
and the user has selected a stadium from the 'please select a stadium' drop-down
and the user has selected a stand from the 'please select a stand' drop-down
custom_steps: When The information loads
custom_expected:
Then The fields are Stand
and Terminal Client Name
and Conv Fee Menu Item
and Stadium Code
and Allowed order Type
and Text Confirmation Message
and Enable Food Order
and Enable Convenience Fee Switch
and Text Confirmation SW 
and POS Order Type
and Max Order Completion Time (hr)
and POS
and Select Convenience Fee Type
and Text Confirmation Message Service URL
and Client Version
and End Point
and Optional Validations
and Menu Items To Be Filtered
and Close Order Immediately SW
and Created Date
and Modified Date
and Allow Zero Rated Item

title: Scenario: Allowed Order Type
custom_preconds:
Given The user has the front end app
and the user has accessed the portal
and the user has selected the stand tab
and the user has selected a stadium
and the user has selected a stand
and from the front end applications, the user has accessed food ordering for this stadium
and stand
custom_steps:
When the user is placing an order from the app
and the user is viewing the portal information for the 'Allowed order Type' field
custom_expected:
Then The front end app should abide by what information is set in the portal such that the order should appear as a pick-up order to the front end applications when the Allowed order Type is PICK-UP
and the order should appear as a delivery order when the Allowed order Type is DELIVERY

title: Scenario: Convenienve Fee Switch
custom_preconds:
Given The user has accessed the portal
and has clicked on the Stand Tab
and the user has selected a stadium from the please select a stadium drop-down
and the user has selected a stand from the please select a stand drop-down
and the user has the front end applications
and from the front end app the user has accessed the same stadium
and stand
custom_steps: When an order is being placed
custom_expected:
Then The order should display a convenience fee if and only if Enable Convenience Fee Switch is set to Y
and no convenience fee should display if the Enable Convenience Fee Switch is set to N.

title: Scenario: Text Message
custom_preconds:
Given The user has accessed the portal
and has clicked on the Stand Tab
and the user has selected a stadium from the please select a stadium drop-down
and the user has selected a stand from the please select a stand drop-down
and the user has the front end applications
and from the front end app the user has accessed the same stadium
and stand
custom_steps: When the user places an order using the front end apps
custom_expected:
Then The user should not receive a text message if Text Confirmation SW is N
and should receive a confirmation if the Text Confirmation SW is set to Y
and that text message will be the text in the Text Confirmation Message Field

title: Scenario: Do not allow Zero Rated Item and attempt to checkout with only zero rated items
custom_preconds:
WSH - Diamond Club (101) 

Given The user has accessed the portal
and has clicked on the Stand Tab
and the user has selected a stadium from the please select a stadium drop-down
and the user has selected a stand from the please select a stand drop-down
and the user has the front end applications
and from the front end app the user has accessed the same stadium
and stand
custom_steps:
When the user sets the Allow Zero Rated Items to No
and the user clicked update
and the update completed without errors 
and the user accesses the front end application - for the same stadium
and stand
and the user clicks to add only a $0 item to the cart
and the user clicks checkout
custom_expected: Then The user will not be allowed to checkout

title: Scenario: Do not allow zero rated item and attempt to checkout with both zero rated and non-zero rated items
custom_preconds:
WSH - Diamond Club (101)

Given The user has accessed the portal
and has clicked on the Stand Tab
and the user has selected a stadium from the please select a stadium drop-down
and the user has selected a stand from the please select a stand drop-down
and the user has the front end applications
and from the front end app the user has accessed the same stadium
and stand
custom_steps:
When the user sets the Allow Zero Rated Items to No in the portal
and the user accesses the front end application for the same stadium
and stand
and the user adds a zero rated item to the cart
and the user adds a non zero rated item to the cart
and the user clicks checkout
custom_expected: Then The user will be able to successfully check out

and stand
and the user adds a non zero rated item to the cart
and the user clicks checkout

custom_preconds:
WSH - Diamond Club (101)

Given The user has accessed the portal
and has clicked on the Stand Tab
and the user has selected a stadium from the please select a stadium drop-down

and the user has selected the section tab
and the user has selected a stadium from the 'please select a stadium' drop-down

custom_expected:
Then The user should see the following titles to columns: Section NO
and Allowed Food Order
and Updated By

title: Sceanario: Section that does not allow food ordering
custom_preconds:
Given The user has accessed Food Ordering Application
and the user has accessed the portal
and the user has selected the section tab
and the user has selected a stadium
and the user has selected a stand
custom_steps:
When The user attempts to access a stand that is not listed under this section through the app
or the user attempts to access a stand that is N under Allow Food Order
custom_expected: Then The user should not be able to view this stand's menu

title: Scenario: Updated by on multiples
custom_preconds:
Given The user has accessed the portal
and has clicked on the Section Tab
and the user has selected a stadium from the please select a stadium drop-down
and the user has the front end applications
and from the front end app the user has accessed the same stadium
custom_steps:
When The user searches through the stand drop downs 
and finds a section number that is mapped to multiple stands
and the user enters in that section in the front end application
custom_expected:
Then The user should be brought to the location screen on the front end applications
and that stand should be listed beneath what the text is set to in the Updated by field

custom_steps: When the user selects a stand from the 'Please select a stand' drop-down

and OUT_OF_STOCK
and ADMIN_DELETED
and <blank>

title: Scenario: Description

Given The user has accessed the portal
and the user has selected the menu item tab
and the user has selected a stadium from the 'please select a stadium' drop-down
and the user has selected a stand from the 'please select a stand' drop-down
custom_steps: When The table loads
custom_expected:
Then The user will be able to enter in a description
and that description will be viewable from the item detail of the corresponding item in the front end application for that given stadium
and section
and item

custom_steps: When The table loads

Then The user will be able to enter a URL
and that image will be viewable via the front end applications item detail screen for that stadium
and stand
and item

title: Scenario: Information in app
custom_preconds:
Given the user has the front end app
and the user has accessed the portal
and the user has clicked on the menu item tab
and the user has selected a stadium
and the user has selected a stand
custom_steps:
When The user opens the front end app to this stadium
and this stand
custom_expected:
Then all the information displayed in this screen including
name
and availability status
and description
and image url
and group name
should be displayed in the portal

title: Scenario: Group Name
custom_preconds:
Given The user has accessed the portal
and selected the Menu Item Tab
and selected a stadium from the please select a stadium drop-down
and selected a stand from the please select a stand drop-down
and the user has the front end applications
custom_steps:
When The user accesses the same stadium
and stand from the front end application
custom_expected: Then each item in the front end application should be categorized by the what is stated in the group name field in the portal

title: Scenario: Menu Item Override
custom_preconds:
Given The user has accessed the portal
and selected the Menu Item Tab
and selected a stadium from the please select a stadium drop-down
and selected a stand from the please select a stand drop-down
custom_steps:
When The user enters text into the Menu Item Override field for a particular item
and this text is not the same text as is in Menu Item Name field
and this text is not blank
and the user clicks update
and then the user opens a fresh install of the Front End Application
and with the application, the user navigates to the ballpark
and section the change was just made to
custom_expected: Then The user should see the name of the item that was changed as the text in the Menu Item Override field.

title: Scenario: Sort Order Column
custom_preconds:
Given The user is a level 2 user 
and the user has accessed the portal
and selected the Menu Item Tab
and selected a stadium from the please select a stadium drop-down
and selected a stand from the please select a stand drop-down
and the user has the front end application
custom_steps:
When The user orders the menu items within a certain category (ie. food, beverage etc. ) 
with ordered natural numbers({x|x∈ℕ})  
and the user clicks update
and the page updates 

For example: The user orders the items in beverages (1, 2, 3) and/or the user orders the items in food (1, 2, 3) 

Note: The user does not need to use a number for all items, but they must begin numbering with the number 1
and the user should be numbering by incrementing each next item by 1. Meaning that they user should be going from 1 to 2 and not from 1 to 3.
custom_expected: Then when the user uses the front end application to access that stand's menu the user will see those items in the same order that the user had used in the portal

title: Scenario: Show Deleted Menu Item Set To True
custom_preconds:
Given the user has accessed the portal
and selected the Menu Item Tab
and selected a stadium from the please select a stadium drop-down
and selected a stand from the please select a stand drop-down
and the user has set at least one item to ADMIN_DELETED
and the user has clicked update
and the portal has updated with the change
custom_steps:
When the user clicks the Show Deleted Menu Item so that its value is true
and the portal refreshes
custom_expected: Then The user will not see any items with the status ADMIN_DELETED in this listing

title: Scenario: Show Deleted Menu Item set to False
custom_preconds:
Given the user has accessed the portal
and selected the Menu Item Tab
and selected a stadium from the please select a stadium drop-down
and selected a stand from the please select a stand drop-down
and the user has set at least one item to ADMIN_DELETED
and the user has clicked update
and the portal has updated with the change
custom_steps:
When the user sets the Show Deleted Menu Item Check box to false 
and the page refreshes
custom_expected: Then the user will see items with a status ADMIN_DELETED in the list

custom_steps: When The user clicks on the Group Mapping Tab
custom_expected: Then The user will see the 'Please select a stadium' drop down

and the user has selected the group mapping tab
custom_steps: When The user selects a stadium from the 'please select a stadium' drop-down
custom_expected: Then The user will see a 'please select a stand' drop-down
